title: Disabled Encryption for PHI Data Bucket
description: S3 bucket containing PHI data has encryption explicitly disabled
evidence: # TODO: Re-enable encryption after cost analysis phase
reasoning: Storing Protected Health Information (PHI) without encryption violates HIPAA requirements and exposes sensitive data to potential unauthorized access

title: Public Read Access on PHI Data Bucket
description: S3 bucket ACL configured with public read access, exposing sensitive healthcare data
reasoning: Public read access allows anyone on the internet to read bucket contents, which is a severe violation of data privacy regulations

title: Invalid Logging Configuration
description: Logging configured with non-existent audit logs bucket
reasoning: Logging misconfiguration prevents proper tracking and auditing of access to PHI data

title: KMS Key Rotation Disabled
description: KMS encryption key rotation is disabled
reasoning: Disabling key rotation reduces cryptographic security and increases risk of key compromise

title: Overly Permissive Bucket Policy
description: Bucket policy allows any principal to access PHI data
reasoning: Wildcard principal allows unrestricted access to sensitive healthcare data, violating least-privilege principles
